What's the URL?

>From: "Tom Tildrum" <Tevildo@...>
>Reply-To: gladiator@egroups.com
>To: gladiator@egroups.com
>Subject: [gladiator] (unknown)
>Date: Fri, 12 Jan 2001 08:45:00 -0500
>
>Okay, for those of you who didn't understand what DPH's last letter was
>about, he sent me a sample of the levels he uses to pump up a team to test
>the limits. They're not particularly fun to play, and they're all basically
>set on the first map, South of Talwood. I noticed that they're designed so
>only a mage or archmage would have a fighting chance of winning...
>
>I'd like to propose a new trainable stat:
>"Not-running-around-like-a-chicken-with-its-head-cut-off". Even with a
>zillion armor, nearby explosions tend to send my characters prancing all
>over the screen, running here and there and subsequently getting scared by
>ghosts. I mean, how shocked and bewildered is an archmage with several
>hundred intelligence going to be if a tower he was shooting at blows up?
>
>Still working on various little Gladiator projects... when they're done 
>I'll
>post them to my Gladiator site. The Warcraft II stuff I've been doing has
>been much quicker to see completion, so I'd better create a page for that
>too. Anyone else out there do levels for Gladiator AND Warcraft? It's so
>much easier to create a storyline with Gladiator, but Warcraft has ships 
>and
>some decent magic...
